TITLE: Many Americans aren't optimistic about their financial situation this year. Here's what they blame
SUMMARY: Rising prices have many Americans worried about their financial future.

TITLE: 5 ways to reset your retirement savings and save more in 2022
SUMMARY: The new year brings opportunities for many Americans in their careers and financial lives.

TITLE: Don’t count on that tax refund yet. Why it may be smaller this year
SUMMARY: If you’re hoping for a tax refund, it may be smaller, or you may owe money this season, according to financial experts. Here’s what filers need to know.

TITLE: Waiting for student loan forgiveness? Here's what to do in the meantime
SUMMARY: Student loan forgiveness could be coming. These are the steps borrowers should and shouldn't take before there's more news.

TITLE: 10 things that will be more expensive in 2022
SUMMARY: Prices are going up in the year ahead. Here's what's going to be more expensive and how to navigate paying more for the things you want.

TITLE: To make your financial New Year's resolutions stick, here's what you need to do
SUMMARY: It's easy to come up with New Year's resolutions and even easier to break them. Experts give their advice on how to stay on track.

TITLE: Now’s the time to boost 401(k) contributions for 2022
SUMMARY: You can funnel $20,500 into your 401(k) plan for 2022, up from $19,500 from 2021. Here's why it may pay off to boost contributions now.

TITLE: Families who got the child tax credit last year need to watch for this letter from the IRS
SUMMARY: The IRS will be sending Letter 6419, which shows how much families received in advanced child tax credit payments, in January.

TITLE: Here is the age when many Americans hope to retire
SUMMARY: "How soon can I retire?" is a question on many Americans' lips. Even as a recent survey shows many workers want to retire earlier, there can be reasons to wait.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot surges to $540 million — yet doesn't even crack the list of 10 largest lottery wins
SUMMARY: Between Powerball and Mega Millions, the top 10 largest jackpots ever won range from $648 million to nearly $1.6 billion.

TITLE: 25 million people got unemployment benefits in 2021. They won't be getting a tax break
SUMMARY: The American Rescue Plan Act waived federal tax on 2020 unemployment benefits. A similar break isn't available this coming tax season.

TITLE: A 5.9% increase to Social Security benefits takes effect this month. Here’s what to expect
SUMMARY: Social Security benefits are poised to get the largest annual increase in decades. Here's what beneficiaries can expect when those checks start this month.

TITLE: Have Covid? You can’t get unemployment benefits
SUMMARY: Americans who get Covid and miss work aren't eligible for unemployment benefits. That wasn't the case earlier in the pandemic.

TITLE: Retirees need to keep this much cash, advisors say
SUMMARY: As retirees kick off the new year, high inflation and strong market returns may leave many wondering how much cash they need to have handy.

TITLE: There are times when it makes sense to sell stocks. Here are some of them
SUMMARY: The less you look at your investment account, the better. Yet there are points in an investor's journey when they need to stop and reevaluate.

TITLE: Auto insurance is expected to cost 5% more in 2022. Here's where it's the most and least expensive
SUMMARY: For 2022, the average national premium for annual car insurance is expected to jump 5% to $1,707, up from $1,663 in 2021, research shows.

TITLE: Verdict in fraud case of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes offers lessons for investors
SUMMARY: Theranos isn’t the only bad apple out there. Here’s how you can protect yourself and your portfolio from corporate fraud.

TITLE: Gen Z and millennials pay three times as much in banking fees than older generations
SUMMARY: Younger generations of Americans are focused on convenience over products and services offered by banking institutions, a survey from Bankrate finds.

TITLE: Eager to travel? Here are the top 22 global hot spots with 'cheap' airfares for 2022
SUMMARY: Scott's Cheap Flights analyzed round-trip airfares from the U.S. to locations all over the world to find 22 spots where historically good fares are on offer.

TITLE: Here are your best money moves before interest rates rise
SUMMARY: Here are some ways to prepare your portfolio for rising rates.

TITLE: Made a killing with crypto in 2021? How to calculate your tax bill
SUMMARY: After a record-breaking year for cryptocurrency in 2021, many investors may soon face a hefty bill for their good fortune. Here’s how to calculate taxes.

TITLE: Fourth stimulus checks not expected as federal government grapples with omicron surge
SUMMARY: Covid-19 cases are rising to record levels. Yet this time around, help in the form of expanded unemployment or stimulus checks is no longer available.

TITLE: Still struggling financially? Here's what pandemic aid remains available to families
SUMMARY: Even as the coronavirus continues to upend American life, most pandemic-era relief measures have dried up by now. Here's what help is still available.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot is now $630 million. If you snag the top prize, here's what to do first
SUMMARY: While the odds of winning the jackpot are miniscule, it's worth giving thought to what winning would mean, and not just financially.

TITLE: Filing your taxes early can help protect against fraud. What to prepare now
SUMMARY: Filing your taxes as soon as possible can protect against fraud and make sure you get any refund you're owed faster. Here's what to prepare now to get ready.

TITLE: If your Medicare Advantage Plan is not a good fit, now is the time to change your coverage
SUMMARY: During the first three months of the year, you can either switch to another Advantage Plan or return to basic Medicare. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Should you max out your IRA early in 2022? Here’s what advisors say
SUMMARY: Eager savers may consider maxing out 2022 individual retirement account contributions early rather than waiting until the tax-filing deadline in 2023.

TITLE: This company just decided to give employees a 4-day workweek permanently
SUMMARY: San Francisco-based tech firm Bolt said it has seen an increase in productivity, as well as better work-life balance for its employees.

TITLE: 1 in 3 Americans overspent during the holidays, boosting credit card balances
SUMMARY: Despite ongoing supply chain problems, inflation and the omicron Covid variant, the holidays in 2021 set records for spending.

TITLE: How rising interest rates may affect muni bond investors
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve’s expected interest rate hikes may have municipal bond investors questioning their holdings. Here's what to know, according to advisors.

TITLE: Didn't get the last stimulus check? There's still time to claim it
SUMMARY: Americans who haven't received their 2021 stimulus checks or got less money than they should have, can claim the payments on their tax returns.

TITLE: Several states have run out of federal rental assistance
SUMMARY: A deluge of applications has forced some states to shut their federal rental assistance programs earlier than expected.

TITLE: Powerball's $632.6 million jackpot has two winners. Here's how much will go to taxes
SUMMARY: Two Powerball tickets — one in California, the other in Wisconsin — matched all six numbers pulled in Wednesday night's drawing.

TITLE: Here’s how to insure your trip amid airline cancellations
SUMMARY: The omicron wave of Covid has resulted in thousands of flight cancellations in recent days. Here's why trip insurance might be a good idea.

TITLE: These 20 companies are coming to this index focused on social and environmental good
SUMMARY: The Transparency Index, which is the basis for a new passive ETF, has unveiled its list of 100 companies for 2022. These names made the list for the first time.

TITLE: No emergency savings? New workplace benefits aim to help
SUMMARY: Employers are offering ways workers can build emergency funds, from savings programs through banks to special accounts alongside traditional retirement plans.

TITLE: Many surprise medical bills are now banned. What to do if you get one anyway
SUMMARY: Certain unexpected medical bills are now banned. But consumers should still be on the lookout for these charges and know what to do if they're hit with one.

TITLE: Many employees could be in for pay hikes of 5% or more in 2022
SUMMARY: As the "Great Resignation" spurs a war for talent, some companies expect to step up with bigger raises this year.

TITLE: Student loan scams increase when payments are paused. What to know
SUMMARY: The continued pause of federal student loan debt and interest has led to some confusion and an uptick in scams. How to protect yourself from falling victim.

TITLE: New and used car prices keep climbing. Don’t expect relief anytime soon
SUMMARY: While an inventory squeeze at dealerships isn't getting worse, pent-up demand is expected to keep inventories low and prices high this year.

TITLE: Your ex-spouse could inherit your money. How to avoid this and other estate-planning mistakes
SUMMARY: While a recent TV plot twist saw a character intentionally leave money to an ex-spouse, it was far-fetched. But there are estate planning mistakes to watch for.
